intro: Potentilla pensylvanica subsp. hispanica, commonly known as Spanish cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring wiry stems and compound leaves with five leaflets. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, five-petaled flowers in early summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
